name: Utils
description: A collection of miscellaneous utility functions, including clipboard access, hashing, encoding, and more.
overview: A collection of miscellaneous utility functions, including clipboard access, hashing, encoding, and more. Accessible from scripts via the global `Utils` variable.

methods.name: openUrl
methods.description: Opens the specified URL in the system's default web browser.

methods.name: openFile
methods.description: Opens the specified file or directory path with the system's default application.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to open, relative to the Minecraft config folder (`.minecraft/config/`).

methods.name: copyToClipboard
methods.description: Copies the given text to the system clipboard.
examples: Utils.copyToClipboard("This text is now on the clipboard!");

methods.name: getClipboard
methods.description: Retrieves the current text content from the system clipboard.

methods.name: guessName
methods.description: Tries to guess the username of a message sender from a chat message. This works for many common chat formats but is not guaranteed to be accurate on all servers.

methods.name: guessNameAndRoles
methods.description: Similar to `guessName`, but attempts to extract all parts of the sender's name, including ranks or titles.

methods.name: hashString
methods.signature: hashString(String message, String algorithm, boolean base64)
methods.description: Hashes a string using a specified cryptographic algorithm.

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: The hashing algorithm to use. Supported values: `sha1`, `sha256`, `sha384`, `sha512`, `md2`, `md5`. Defaults to "sha256".

parameters.name: base64
parameters.description: If `true`, the resulting hash is encoded in Base64. Otherwise, it's encoded in hexadecimal. Defaults to false.

methods.name: encode
methods.description: Encodes a string using Base64 encoding.

methods.name: decode
requireNonNull
methods.description: Checks if an object is `null`. If it is, it throws a `NullPointerException`, effectively stopping the script with an error. If the object is not `null`, it returns the object.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to check for nullity.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An optional custom message to include in the `NullPointerException` if the object is `null`.
